nodes.text: It is now time for your final exam. We will go over your answers tomorrow in class, so you will be able to judge for yourself whether or not you are worthy to be at this university for Heroes.
Do well - or suffer the consequences of your own foolishness.
Which of the following is not a 'Rule for Rogues?'

options.text: Thou Shalt Not Steal (from School or Classmates).
When in doubt - get the hell out.

nodes.text: Which of the following can be used as a Thieves' Tool?
What is the Way of the Küchenschabe?

options.text: A method of clearing your throat.
A warning to "Stop, Look, and Listen" while sneaking.
The path a cockroach makes as it explores a kitchen.

nodes.text: In the Way of the Fledermaus, what should one do?

options.text: Close one's eyes when exploring dark places
Become a vigilante hero to put terror in the hearts of villains

nodes.text: The lesson of avoiding conflict by avoiding danger is called...

options.text: The Way of the Ungefaehrliche Dinge

nodes.text: What is the lesson of "The Way of the Spider?"

options.text: The female of the species is more deadly than the male
That 'Spinne' is the Germanish term for spider

Oh, what a tangled web we weave
When first we practice to deceive!
Traps can be a Rogue's best tool and most dangerous challenge

nodes.text: Why is it good for a Rogue to have friends?

options.text: You never know when you will need a plausible alibi
It helps to have someone watching your back who doesn't want to stick a dagger into it
It is good to have someone with whom to share one's dreams and ambitions
If you can't trust another Rogue, who can you trust?

nodes.text: Who most deserves to be 'Rogue of the Year?'

options.text: Someone who steals from the rich and gives to the poor
Someone who uses intelligence more than a dagger when confronted by danger
Someone whose wit is as sharp as a dagger, whose smile is as useful as a lockpick, and whose stealth is a better defense than any shield.

nodes.text: Which would you rather be - a Rogue or a Thief?
